origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Women's Advocate Office.

did.unittitle: Women's Advocate Office (University of Michigan) records 1970-1976
did.abstract: Papers, 1970-1976, of the Women's Advocate of the University of Michigan, office created to meet the personal and legal needs of women at the University of Michigan. Contain reference and topical files concerning women's issues, especially abortion, childcare, health care, legal problems, affirmative action, and equal rights.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The papers were received from the Women's Advocate Office (donor no. 6122).

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Women's Advocate Office (University of Michigan) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Women's Advocate Office was created to meet the personal and legal needs of women at the University of Michigan. The activities of the Women's Advocate Office have been taken over by the Commission for Women and by the Academic Women's Caucus, affiliated with the Affirmative Action Office.

scopecontent.p: A large part of the collection consists of reference files of articles related to women's issues. Topical files include materials on career planning, the Center for Continuing Education of Women, the Women's Media Center, and childcare programs and other projects for women at the university. Annual reports, evaluations and various committee reports related to the work of the Women's Advocate Office are also included.
